header.title: The Most Sexist Things Women Have Experienced at Work #BeBoldForChange
header.subtitle: NA
header.postText: In recognition of International Women's Day, which takes place this year on 8th March 2017, Expert Market scoured the London streets for women who were willing to share their experiences of sexism in the workplace.  And we didn't have to look too far! Sexist remarks at work seem all too prevalent. From unfair uniform rules to crude remarks in the office, workplace sexism is rife. The International Women's Day campaign asks that we #BeBoldForChange. Here at Expert Market we agree - it's time to take a stand on workplace sexism in 2017. Website: http://www.expertmarket.co.uk/focus. http://www.expertmarket.com/focus. Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/expertmarketuk. https://www.facebook.com/expertmarketus. Twitter: https://twitter.com/expertmarket. https://twitter.com/ExpertMarketUS. Expert Market is the UK's leading B2B marketplace, helping businesses connect with suppliers. Visit our channel for more videos! http://bit.ly/1PHfQfX

commentThread.commentText: It has been my experience that what women find objectionable is crassness and repetitious overtures by pests. Attractive men rarely get reported for single overtures. Repugnant, plain men, if I can put it that way, are more likely to attract opprobrium, except from sweet natured girls who feel sorry for them. Woman, generally, have a higher emotional awareness than men and appreciate how socially clumsy many "blokes" are. It's true that many young women want men to notice them. If that were not true, we wouldn't have so much money spent on alluring fashion items and cosmetic surgery. It just comes down to treating women respectfully and not invading their social space.

commentThread.commentText: I am a Male. I have experienced sexism at work. Employed in South Australian Government DHS. It went like this. I am looking for some filing dividers in a cupboard. There where non. I asked the Directors side kick where i could get some? She said; did you look? Answer; yes i did. Reply; send me an e mail request and i get some, in a very snappy and unfriendly way toward me. I send e mail. She called over later showing me some dividers she was holding in her hand and asked me if my looking was a Man's look? I calmly responded stating that my effort was a normal look. It turned out the dividers where in an adjacent cabinet i never felt any business looking in. I stated that i was never told that they where stored in that cabinet and that i was allowed to access it. So there you have it! If I, as a Man said to that Women or perhaps another Women i be more than likely be copping sexism in making a statement such as; Was it a women kind of looking? So listen Girls. We cop it too. It is not always Women. But Men are expected to take it and many never report it so as not to be ridiculed. 😯🇦🇺🇦🇺👎

commentThread.commentText: There are several reasons for the low reproduction rate of intelligent white females. 1. Young women have been indoctrinated by radical feminists who control the education system. They are taught to do the same thing as men and to put a working career ahead of being a parent. To demonstrate this you only have to look at the almost insane attention that was given to the mythical 'pay gap' and the high level of propaganda used to generate such myths. 2. Women are taught that men are evil. The enormous exaggerations regarding sexual assault / sexual harassment / domestic violence ... demonstrate this. (Shown in videos such as RAPE HYSTERIA - Part 1 | History Repeats Itself ) 3. High levels of government welfare means that women no longer need a strong family group for security. 4. Funding. Governments fund feminist causes to win the female vote. Women vote collectively on women's issues, men also support women. George Soros also funds feminism through his Open Society Foundation (he funds all causes that destabilise white countries).

And there's a really good prager U video that debunks the wage gap entirely. And just because a man is in a gym and sees a pretty woman, that means he can't look at her? When a guy sees a pretty girl, however many seconds he spends looking at her is how long he spends forgetting about her. He'll be at home later, unaware that she ever existed. So please, where is it written that there's moral inequality between men and women?

GerudoKing This is perceived as sexism because strangers start paying attention to you and they know nothing about you, solely how pretty your face is or how big your boobs are. We are getting equality, and everything is going great, but there are still millions of sexist people out there, catcallin g woman and such may only be minor things, but they are existing problems none the less.

That's the thing. If I see a pretty woman down the street, what's wrong with checking her out? I don't catcall, and I shame those who do. But that is nowhere NEAR as bad as it was decades ago. There will always be a concept of sexism, not just on girls, but on boys as well. You can't emasculate boys from doing boyish things, such as seeing a pretty girl and being naturally attracted to the opposit e sex. You ALSO can't keep girls from doing girlish things, like having children (in relation to things like abortion.) There are separate strengths and weaknesses that both the majority of boys and the majority of girls have. We need to accept that and come to terms with it instead of stifle it in to nothing. Since the dawn of time women have been called sweetheart, not out of an act of superiority, but out of an act of kindness and affection. Has the goal of feminism changed so radically that we're trying to get rid of acts of kindness? Really?

@GerudoKing Wether women like to admit it or not they catcall guys, too. Maybe not to the same degree but it still happens a lot, you just don't hear about it because who wants to listen to a guy saying a group of women were objectifying him by calling him hot? He would get laughed out of the building!
